citations.narrative:
Licensee did not have a documented appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation,
housing and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Contingency plans must identify situations
the licensee might experience that would trigger the need for measures identified in the contingency plan to be put into
action, outline specific tasks, chain of command and response and recovery. Personnel must be trained on the plan and
any changes made as a result of annual reviews.
Correct by 31 March 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
Licensee did not have a documented appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, 
housing and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.  Contingency plans must identify situations 
the licensee might experience that would trigger the need for measures identified in the contingency plan to be put into 
action, outline specific tasks, chain of command and response and recovery.  Personnel must be trained on the plan and 
any changes made as a result of annual reviews. 
 
Correct by 31 March 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
